briefTitle: A Study to Evaluate the Safety, Immune Response, and Efficacy of Gardasil (V501, qHPV) in Mid-Adult Women (V501-019)
officialTitle: Safety, Immunogenicity, and Efficacy of Gardasil (V501 (Human Papilloma Virus [Types 6, 11, 16, 18] Recombinant Vaccine) in Mid-Adult Women - The FUTURE III (Females United to Unilaterally Reduce Endo/Ectocervical Cancer) Study
conditions: Human Papillomavirus Recombinant Vaccine Quadrivalent, Types 6, 11, 16, 18
summary: This study was conducted to assess the safety, immunogenicity, efficacy and long-term effectiveness of a vaccine being evaluated for the prevention of human papillomavirus (HPV) infection and disease in mid-adult women.

primaryOutcome.measure: Incidence Rate of HPV 6/11/16/18 Related Persistent Infection, Genital Warts, VIN, VaIN, Vulvar Cancer, Vaginal Cancer, Cervical Dysplasia, Cervical AIS, and Cervical Cancer
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Up to 48 months (4 years) after the first dose of qHPV vaccine in the Base Study
